results.title: Fair treatment
results.creator_credit: Chris McGill, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Tim Johnson
results.brief_description: This program examines some of the most important issues facing people living with HIV and contains interviews with people who are HIV positive. It focuses on the availability of drugs for HIV patients, and the lack of action and apathy shown by Australian governments. It also explores the outlook on life of the interviewees, how the stigma of AIDS, the death of friends and loved ones has affected them and finally examines their attitudes to death and dying.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris McGill, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Tim Johnson

results.title: Fair play
results.creator_credit: Janet Bell, Susan Lambert and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australian women cricketers are the undisputed world-cup cricket champions in a sport which is hotly contested by nine affiliated countries. This film follows their latest tour to England to play on the hallowed grounds at Lords.

results.title: Fair play
results.creator_credit: Jack Wipper, Sterling Educational Films and Edmund Penney
results.brief_description: The film encourages judgements on three situations which occur in play. The experiences of the playground are important social lessons. Sharing, kindness and responsibility for each other’s well being are some of the elements of “fair play”.

results.brief_description: Footage of what appears to be an amateur documentary by a member of the Australian Shooting Team that took part in the 37th World Shooting Championships in Moscow, 1958. No production details available. Silent film.

results.title: Failing to learn, learning to fail (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: National Broadcasting Company, Films Incorporated and Mike Gavin
results.brief_description: Investigates the relationship between learning disabilities and delinquent behaviour by examining the history of four youngsters afflicted with minimal brain dysfunction. Points out the importance of early diagnosis and reports on the progress being made in the treatment of this disorder.

constellations_other.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

group_works.title: Family matters

results.title: Facts about projection
results.creator_credit: Wesley Greene, John Ott Pictures and Robert Edmonds
results.brief_description: Explains how a projectionist can put on a professional 16mm sound film screening by observing a check list of hints and safeguards. Emphasises the importance of a pre-showing check of the kind and source of power, light control facilities and ventilation; of the correct set-up of projector, speaker and screen; placement and plugging of cords; adjustment of focus, screen size, tone and volume controls and a final check for clean aperture before threading.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wesley Greene, John Ott Pictures and Robert Edmonds

results.title: Facts about fish
results.brief_description: A study of the various types of fish including the tropical triggerfish; the ray, sole and plaice; sea sticklebacks, pipefish, sea horses, giant catfish, mirror and golden carp and small sturgeons; freshwater pike and perch.
